attributes.action: mandate a cut of 50% in a GP's salary should they not provide an out of hours visiting service
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Prior to April 2004 GPs were required to provide an out of hours service between 6:30pm and 8.00am on week days and over the weekend.

A GP can opt out of this responsibility in return for giving up on average £6000pa. Given a GP “earns” over £100,000pa, the attractiveness of the opt out becomes apparent. Further, trying to get a GP to visit you out of hours is almost impossible.

Being a GP is a vocational job and in the service of the public. Unfortunately most maladies don’t recognise a GP's day time hours. A patient can find themselves debilitated by many illnesses that require a professional to assess. This should be in their own home and at any time, 24 hours a day, 7 days a week.

For this reason I petition that a GP's salary is cut by 50% if they do not provide an out of hours visiting service.
